intro: Tetracera sarmentosa var. loureiroi, commonly known as the creeping tetracera, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in secondary forests and disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
